NasDem Tak Setuju JPO Sudirman Tak Beratap: Singapura Saja Tertutup
06 Nov 2019, 09:24 by Zunita Putri
Jakarta - Wakil Ketua Komisi D dari Fraksi NasDem, Nova Harian Paloh, mempertanyakan kebijakan Pemprov DKI yang membongkar atap jembatan penyeberangan orang (JPO) di kawasan Sudirman, Jakarta. Nova mengaku tak setuju dengan kebijakan JPO terbuka karena dinilai mengganggu kenyamanan warga.
"Kalau kita lihat dalam pembahasan ada KUA-PPAS revitalisasi JPO, artinya JPO ke depan ada modernisasi, ada rencana pakai lift lah buat disabilitas. Tapi kalau sekarang itu JPO dibuka, saya sangat sayangkan sekali karena tujuannya buat apa kalau itu dibuka?" kata Nova saat dihubungi, Senin (6/11/2019).
Nova menilai JPO itu seharusnya ditutup. Jika Pemprov beralasan agar warga dapat melihat pemandangan Jakarta, dia mengatakan dengan dipakainya atap pada JPO itu tak akan mengubah keindahan Jakarta. Dia juga meminta desain JPO mengutamakan keselamatan dan kenyamanan.
"Ya kalau saya sih harus dtututupi semua lah, kalau dibuka emang kita mau foto-foto? Di Singapura aja JPO ketutup semua," jelasnya.
"Di mana-mana JPO tertutup, karena ada JPO pasti ada halte, ada halte juga pasti ada kantor dekat situ. Ini gimana kalau hujan suapaya masyarakat juga terlindungi? Jadi ketika dia turun-naik bus, ada halte di situ cepat-cepat juga dia ke situ, perencanannya kan gitu," ucapnya.
Diketahui, pencopotan atap di jembatan penyeberangan orang (JPO) di Jalan Jenderal Sudirman merupakan arahan Anies. Dia yakin nantinya JPO tanpa atap jadi spot selfie baru di Jakarta.
"Apa yang terjadi kalau nanti dibuka? Itu tempat selfie paling sering karena pemandangan gedung di malam hari bagus sekali, sore, siang. Atapnya copot, itu langsung jadi space terbuka," kata Anies saat rapat.

NasDem disapproves of Sudirman JPO: It is closed: Singapore is closed
Nov 6, 2019, 09:24 by Zunita Putri
Jakarta - Deputy Chairman of Commission D from the NasDem Faction, Nova Harian Paloh, questioned the DKI Jakarta Provincial Government's policy of dismantling the roof of the pedestrian crossing bridge (JPO) in the Sudirman area, Jakarta. Nova admitted that she did not agree with JPO's open policy because it was considered disturbing the comfort of the residents.
"If we see in the discussion there is a KUA-PPAS revitalizing JPO, meaning that in the future there is a modernization of the JPO, there are plans to use an elevator for disability. Nova said when contacted on Monday (11/06/2019).
Nova assessed that the JPO should be closed. If the Provincial Government argues that residents can see the view of Jakarta, he said that wearing the roof on the JPO would not change the beauty of Jakarta. He also requested that the JPO design prioritize safety and comfort.
"Yes, if I have to cover everything, if we open, do we want photos? In Singapore, JPO is all covered," he explained.
"Everywhere JPO is closed, because there is a JPO there must be a bus stop, there is also a bus stop there must also be an office nearby. What if the rain is also protected by the public? So when he gets on the bus, there is a bus stop there too quickly there, planning is like that, "he said.
It is known, the removal of the roof on the pedestrian bridge (JPO) on Jalan Jenderal Sudirman is Anies's direction. He is sure that JPO without a roof will become a new selfie spot in Jakarta.
"What happens if you open it later? That place is the most frequent selfie because the view of the building at night is great, afternoon, afternoon. The roof is dislodged, it immediately becomes open space," Anies said during a meeting.
